intro: Aneilema semifoliatum, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often forming a compact rosette of foliage. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink and purple, bloom in spring and summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Aneilema semifoliatum is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
